member.name: T:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of attributes present in the current html tag.

member.summary: Gets the named attribute.

member.summary: Determines whether the collection contains the specified key.

member.summary: Efficient way to determine if a style is equals to a value.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetColor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an attribute representing a color (named color, hexadecimal or hexadecimal without the preceding # character).

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetUnit(System.String,HtmlToOpenXml.UnitMetric)
member.summary: Gets an attribute representing an unit: 120px, 10pt, 5em, 20%, ...
member.returns: If the attribute is misformed, the property is set to false.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetMargin(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an attribute representing the 4 unit sides. If a side has been specified individually, it will override the grouped definition.
member.returns: If the attribute is misformed, the property is set to false.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetBorders
member.summary: Gets an attribute representing the 4 border sides. If a border style/color/width has been specified individually, it will override the grouped definition.
member.returns: If the attribute is misformed, the property is set to false.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetSideBorder(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an attribute representing a single border side. If a border style/color/width has been specified individually, it will override the grouped definition.
member.returns: If the attribute is misformed, the property is set to false.

member.summary: Gets the `font` attribute and combine with the style, size and family.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlAttributeCollection.GetTextDecorations(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the composite `text-decoration` style.

member.name: T:HtmlToOpenXml.OpenXmlDocumentStyleCollection
member.summary: Typed collection that holds the Style of a document and their name. OpenXml is case-sensitive but CSS is not. This collection handles both cases.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.OpenXmlDocumentStyleCollection.TryGetValueIgnoreCase(System.String,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Wordprocessing.StyleValues,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Wordprocessing.Style@)
member.summary: Gets the style associated with the specified name.
member.param: The name whose style to get.
Specify the type of style seeked (Paragraph or Character).
When this method returns, the style associated with the specified name, if the key is found; otherwise, returns null. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

member.name: T:HtmlToOpenXml.ImageProcessingMode
member.summary: Specifies how images should be processed during HTML to OpenXML conversion.

member.name: F:HtmlToOpenXml.ImageProcessingMode.Embed
member.summary: Downloads and embeds all images into the document (default behaviour). This creates self-contained documents but may result in large file sizes.

member.name: F:HtmlToOpenXml.ImageProcessingMode.LinkExternal
member.summary: Links to external images via external relationships instead of downloading them. This keeps document size small but images won't display offline or if URLs become unavailable. Data URI images (base64 encoded) are still embedded.

member.name: F:HtmlToOpenXml.ImageProcessingMode.EmbedDataUriOnly
member.summary: Only embeds data URI images (base64 encoded inline images). External images (http/https/file) are skipped entirely.

member.name: T:HtmlToOpenXml.Expressions.BlockElementExpression
member.summary: Process the parsing of block contents (like p, span, heading). A block-level element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element.
Intrepret all the child nodes and combine them.
member.param: The child parsing context.
The list of child nodes.
The parent paragraph properties to apply.
Optionally insert new runs at the beginning of the processing.
Optionally insert new runs at the end of the processing.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.AcronymPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets where to render the acronym or abbreviation tag.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.SupportsAnchorLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anchor links are included or not in the conversion (defaults ).
member.remarks:
An anchor is a term used to define a hyperlink destination inside a document. .
It exists some predefined anchors used by Word such as _top to refer to the top of the document. The anchor #_top is always accepted regardless this property value. For others anchors like refering to your own bookmark or a title, add a and elements and set the value of href to #name of your bookmark.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.ExcludeLinkAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets whether anchor links are included or not in the conversion.
member.remarks:
An anchor is a term used to define a hyperlink destination inside a document. .
It exists some predefined anchors used by Word such as _top to refer to the top of the document. The anchor #_top is always accepted regardless this property value. For others anchors like refering to your own bookmark or a title, add a and elements and set the value of href to #name of your bookmark.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.HtmlStyles
member.summary: Gets the Html styles manager mapping to OpenXml style properties.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.TableCaptionPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets where the Legend tag (caption) should be rendered (above or below the table).

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.RenderPreAsTable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pre tag should be rendered as a table (defaults ).
member.remarks: The table will contains only one cell.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.ImageProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets how images should be processed during conversion.

remarks.para: Use (default) to download and embed all images, creating self-contained documents but potentially large file sizes.
Use to link to external images via relationships, keeping document size small but requiring internet access to view images. Data URI images (base64 encoded) are still embedded.
Use to only embed data URI images and skip external images entirely.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.ContinueNumbering
member.summary: Defines whether ordered lists (ol) continue incrementing existing numbering or restarts to 1 (defaults continues numbering).

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.SupportsHeadingNumbering
member.summary: Defines whether any headings (h1-h6) could be considered as multi-level numbering, such as top-level headings (Heading 1) are numbered 1, 2, 3, for example, and second-level headings (Heading 2) are numbered 1.1, 1.2, 1.3. This feature is enabled by default.
member.remarks: The converter is detecting headings starting with a number (ie: 1. or 1 ) are considered as numbering.

member.name: P:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlConverter.MainPart
member.summary: Gets the mainDocumentPart of the destination OpenXml document.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.HtmlFont.Parse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Parse the font style attribute.
member.remarks: The font shorthand property sets all the font properties in one declaration. The properties that can be set, are (in order): "font-style font-variant font-weight font-size/line-height font-family" The font-size and font-family values are required. If one of the other values are missing, the default values will be inserted, if any. ///

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.Margin.#ctor(HtmlToOpenXml.Unit,HtmlToOpenXml.Unit,HtmlToOpenXml.Unit,HtmlToOpenXml.Unit)

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.Margin.Parse(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Parse the margin style attribute.
member.remarks:
The margin property can have from one to four values. margin:25px 50px 75px 100px; top margin is 25px right margin is 50px bottom margin is 75px left margin is 100px
margin:25px 50px 75px; top margin is 25px right and left margins are 50px bottom margin is 75px
margin:25px 50px; top and bottom margins are 25px right and left margins are 50px
margin:25px; all four margins are 25px

member.summary: The common characters considered as white space.

member.summary: Shim method to remain compliant with pre-NET 8 framework.

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.SpanExtensions.Split(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Range},System.Char,System.StringSplitOptions)
member.summary: Parses the source for the specified , populating the span with instances representing the regions between the separators.
member.param: The source span to parse.
The destination span into which the resulting ranges are written.
A character that delimits the regions in this instance.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specifies whether to trim whitespace and include empty ranges.
member.returns: The number of ranges written into .

member.name: M:HtmlToOpenXml.SpanExtensions.SplitCompositeAttribute(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char},System.Span{System.Range},System.Char,System.Nullable{System.Char})
member.summary: Parses the source for the specified style attribute separators, populating the span with instances representing the regions between the separators.
member.param: The source span to parse.
The destination span into which the resulting ranges are written.
A character that delimits the regions in this instance.
If is preceded by this character, the separator will be treated as a normal character.
member.returns: The number of ranges written into .

member.summary: Defines the styles to apply on OpenXml elements.

member.summary: Occurs when a Style is missing in the MainDocumentPart but will be used during the conversion process.

member.summary: Preload the styles in the document to match localized style name.

member.summary: Helper method to obtain the StyleId of a named style (invariant or localized name).
member.param: The name of the style to look for.
True to obtain the character version of the given style.
Indicate whether the search should be performed with the case-sensitive flag or not.
member.returns: If not found, returns the given name argument.

member.name: P:System.Range.Start
member.summary: Represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:System.Range.End
member.summary: Represent the exclusive end index of the Range.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.
